trans-unit.source: Get Started with Mobile Services for Windows Store apps (C#) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Mobile Services for Windows Store apps (C#) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Windows Store development in C#.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Windows Store development in C#.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.INCLUDE [mobile-services-selector-get-started](../../includes/mobile-services-selector-get-started.md)]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.INCLUDE [mobile-services-selector-get-started](../../includes/mobile-services-selector-get-started.md)]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a universal Windows app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a universal Windows app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows app solutions include projects for both Windows Store 8.1 and Windows Phone Store 8.1 apps and a common shared project.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows app solutions include projects for both Windows Store 8.1 and Windows Phone Store 8.1 apps and a common shared project.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Build universal Windows apps that target Windows and Windows Phone](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/dn609832.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Build universal Windows apps that target Windows and Windows Phone](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/dn609832.aspx).

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple *To do list* app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple *To do list* app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you will create uses JavaScript for server-side business logic.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you will create uses JavaScript for server-side business logic.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio, see the .NET backend version of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio, see the .NET backend version of this topic.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-javascript-get-started%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-javascript-get-started%2F).

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows]
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows]

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Create a new universal Windows app
trans-unit.target: Create a new universal Windows app

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Azure classic portal to either create a new universal Windows app or modify an existing Windows Store or Windows Phone app project to connect to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Azure classic portal to either create a new universal Windows app or modify an existing Windows Store or Windows Phone app project to connect to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new universal Windows app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new universal Windows app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click **Windows** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Windows Store app**.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click **Windows** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Windows Store app**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the three easy steps to create a Windows Store app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the three easy steps to create a Windows Store app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: ![Mobile Services quickstart steps](./media/mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started/mobile-quickstart-steps.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Mobile Services quickstart steps](./media/mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started/mobile-quickstart-steps.png)

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install [Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows] on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install [Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows] on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your app**, select a language for your app, then click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your app**, select a language for your app, then click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample *To do list* application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample *To do list* application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Run your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Run your Windows app

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the MainPage.xaml.cs file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the MainPage.xaml.cs file.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source: [Get started with offline data sync] Learn how to use offline data sync to make your app responsive and robust.
trans-unit.target: [Get started with offline data sync] Learn how to use offline data sync to make your app responsive and robust.

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to your Mobile Services app ][Get started with authentication] Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to your Mobile Services app ][Get started with authentication] Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: [Add push notifications to your app][Get started with push notifications] Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target: [Add push notifications to your app][Get started with push notifications] Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.

trans-unit.source: [How to use the .NET client library](mobile-services-dotnet-how-to-use-client-library.md) Learn how to query the mobile service, work with data, and access custom APIs.
trans-unit.target: [How to use the .NET client library](mobile-services-dotnet-how-to-use-client-library.md) Learn how to query the mobile service, work with data, and access custom APIs.
